name: Khalil Center
mission: Our wellness centers integrate Islamic spiritual approaches into professional psychology to help achieve optimal, holistic health by providing a wide variety of mental health services.
theoryOfChange: Khalil Center utilizes a 'Traditional Islamically Integrated Psychotherapy (TIIP)' therapeutic framework, which serves as their model of care. This framework integrates professional psychology into an Islamic framework, drawing from a 1400-year-old tradition. Their approach emphasizes psychological reconstruction, behavioral reformation, and spiritual elevation. The TIIP model considers the complex construct of a human being, focusing on 'aql (cognition), nafs (behavioral inclinations), rūḥ (spirit), and iḥsās (emotions). It integrates classical spiritual practices like Murāqabah (Islamic Contemplation), Duʿā (Supplications), and Dhikr into clinical practice. The 2023 Annual Report states that the TIIP model has been proven and is officially recognized as an evidence-based modality for the Muslim population.

evaluationSources: Practice-based evidence study published in Spirituality in Clinical Practice
Research published in Journal of Muslim Mental Health

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat (Source: https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: ibn_sabil (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 39/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Strengthen reserves toward a resilient policy range (commonly 3-12 months), based on revenue volatility and program obligations.
components.name: Financial Health

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Khalil Foundation shows strong alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat (Source: https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The Khalil Foundation is registered under EIN 47-1313957 and provides clinical mental health services.
The charity is zakat-eligible and maintains a specific zakat policy for asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,272,898 and a program expense ratio of 71.2%.
The center tracks clinical appointments and provides professional training scholarships.
The organization delivers psychotherapy sessions and didactic trainings as part of its core programming.
The foundation offers multiple giving methods and donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score of 66/100, reflecting high alignment with Muslim donor needs and efficient fundraising, balanced against low data confidence and modest financial reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with only 2.4 months of working capital available
Low data confidence due to limited third-party verification of impact metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is high (39/50) due to the organization's specific focus on humanitarian mental health needs within a faith-based framework [2]. The charity is explicitly zakat-eligible, offering donors a way to fulfill religious obligations through professional psychological support services [2][6].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a capacity-building approach by delivering psychotherapy sessions and didactic trainings, though the cost per beneficiary remains relatively high at approximately $907.87 [4][5]. While the program expense ratio is solid at 71.2%, the low data confidence score of 0.3 suggests a need for more rigorous external evaluation of long-term clinical outcomes [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Khalil Foundation integrates spiritual wellness with psychological expertise to provide faith-based mental health services to the Muslim community.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Verified zakat-eligible status with a dedicated policy for asnaf categories
Strong programmatic focus with 71.2% of expenses directed toward clinical and educational services
baseline_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, provides specialized clinical mental health services and community education rooted in Islamic principles [1][4]. In the most recent fiscal period, the organization reported a total revenue of $2,272,898 to support its psychological and spiritual wellness programs [3].
